content: CPF AMA Christopher Tan Asked by AnonymousAsked on 24 Jan 2019Do the monies in the RA of CPF continue to compound between ages 65-70? Are there advantages to delaying the payouts to 70 as opposed to 65?CPF2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Christopher Tan, Executive Director at MoneyOwl Private limitedLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 26 Jan 2019Hi anonymous, thanks for your question and sorry for the late reply. Hariz has answered your question below and he is right. 0 comments1

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 25 Jan 2019Yes, you'll receive a 7% increase in payout of your CPF Life plan for every year you defer. 0 comments0
